I've double-checked with my trackpad, which works perfectly.

Let's try a few system settings: Go to Ã¯Â£Â¿ > System Preferences > Trackpad. Enable "Tap to click" and "Secondary click."

Then launch KSP, and without switching out of the KSP window (go make some tea/coffee?), try each of these:

  • Tap on the filters with one finger
  • Tap on the filters with two fingers
  • Click with one finger
  • Click with two fingers
  • Control+click with one finger

Another option: move your KSP/settings.cfg out of the folder, then start KSP.

If none of these work, try uploading your Player.log: Mac OS X: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log ( Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log )

ok, weird...

If I go in map view and swipe three finger to the "up" of the trackpad and then change the application with that swiping(do you know what I'm talking about?) I can do it.

However, after I quitted map view, I have to redo it..

Well, I have found the work-around until it get fixed somehow!

Thank you very much for the help!

You have to have the navball open in order to filter everything.

If you hide the navball, for some reason clicking on the filter options become impossible.
